sections.heading: Overview
sections.content: At Raghubir Singh Junior Modern School, the Visual Arts curriculum encourages children to explore colour, form, and texture through a range of media. Art is viewed not only as a creative activity but also as a way to develop patience, perception, and emotional intelligence. Every artwork is treated as an individual expression of thought and feeling.

sections.heading: Art and Craft
sections.content: Students experiment with various forms such as drawing, painting, collage, origami, and design work. Art periods are carefully planned to complement academic learning while giving children space for imagination. The display boards in every corridor reflect a vibrant tapestry of student creativity, where even the simplest effort finds appreciation and encouragement.

sections.heading: Clay Modelling
sections.content: Working with clay introduces students to the tactile joy of creation. Children learn basic sculpting techniques and explore spatial understanding while shaping figures, pottery, and models. Clay classes enhance fine motor skills and patience, providing a meditative counterbalance to academic rigour.

sections.heading: Exhibitions and Displays
sections.content: Every year, RSJMS holds art exhibitions showcasing the creative work of students. These exhibitions are open to parents and visitors, reflecting the schoolâ€™s belief that art is a communal celebration. The Art Room and Clay Room remain some of the most loved spaces in the school, filled with colour, laughter, and inspiration.
